<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 170, 195, 201]]<|/det|> CANDIDATE NAME <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 222, 171, 250]]<|/det|> CENTRE NUMBER <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[210, 210, 425, 259]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[620, 220, 722, 250]]<|/det|> CANDIDATE NUMBER <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[735, 210, 905, 256]]<|/det|> <|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 278, 170, 293]]<|/det|> ## PHYSICS <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 298, 264, 314]]<|/det|> Paper 5 Practical Test <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 338, 415, 354]]<|/det|> Candidates answer on the Question Paper. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 358, 584, 374]]<|/det|> Additional Materials: As listed in the Confidential Instructions. <|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 390, 388, 407]]<|/det|> ## READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 416, 777, 432]]<|/det|> Write your centre number, candidate number and name in the spaces at the top of the page. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 432, 320, 446]]<|/det|> Write in dark blue or black pen. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 446, 504, 461]]<|/det|> You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 460, 504, 475]]<|/det|> Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 475, 380, 490]]<|/det|> DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 501, 255, 516]]<|/det|> Answer all questions. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 515, 860, 545]]<|/det|> You are advised to spend about 20 minutes on each of questions 1 to 3, and 15 minutes on question 4. Electronic calculators may be used. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 543, 767, 559]]<|/det|> You may lose marks if you do not show your working or if you do not use appropriate units. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 568, 604, 584]]<|/det|> At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 583, 759, 599]]<|/det|> The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question. <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[710, 648, 905, 842]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 852, 839, 866]]<|/det|> This syllabus is regulated for use in England, Wales and Northern Ireland as a Cambridge International Level 1/Level 2 Certificate. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[265, 874, 730, 891]]<|/det|> This document consists of 11 printed pages and 1 blank page. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 902, 242, 927]]<|/det|> DC (NF/CGW) 171388/4 © UCLES 2019 <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[384, 895, 611, 927]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[819, 913, 905, 928]]<|/det|> [Turn over

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 73, 96, 89]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 806, 89]]<|/det|> In this experiment, you will determine the mass of a block U by a balancing method. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 102, 576, 121]]<|/det|> Carry out the following instructions, referring to Fig. 1.1. <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 131, 920, 285]]<|/det|> <|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[465, 303, 532, 320]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 333, 146, 352]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 333, 920, 367]]<|/det|> Place the metre rule with the pivot below the \(50.0 \text{cm}\) mark. **The pivot must stay in this position for the duration of the experiment.** <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 380, 697, 397]]<|/det|> Place block U on the metre rule with its centre at the \(5.0 \text{cm}\) mark. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 411, 920, 444]]<|/det|> Place block M on the metre rule on the other side of the pivot as shown in Fig. 1.1. Adjust the position of block M until the metre rule is as near to being balanced as possible. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 458, 920, 492]]<|/det|> The distance a between the centre of block U and the \(50.0 \text{cm}\) mark has been recorded in Table 1.1. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 505, 512, 523]]<|/det|> In Table 1.1, record the position of block M. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 536, 920, 570]]<|/det|> Calculate the distance \(b\) between the centre of block U and the centre of block M, using the equation: <|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[368, 583, 745, 600]]<|/det|> \[b = (\text{position of block M} - \text{position of block U}).\] <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 612, 920, 645]]<|/det|> Repeat the procedure for positions of block U at the \(10.0 \text{cm}\), \(15.0 \text{cm}\), \(20.0 \text{cm}\) and \(25.0 \text{cm}\) marks. <|ref|>table_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[457, 674, 539, 691]]<|/det|> Table 1.1 <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[267, 705, 730, 881]]<|/det|>
position of block U/cm\(a/\text{cm}\)position of block M/cm\(b/\text{cm}\)
5.045.0
10.040.0
15.035.0
20.030.0
25.025.0

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 148, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
Plot a graph of \(b / \text{cm}\) (\(y\)-axis) against \(a / \text{cm}\) (\(x\)-axis). You do not need to start the axis at the origin (0,0).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 725, 895, 745]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[544, 757, 920, 776]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
In this experiment, you will investigate the transfer of thermal energy between hot water in a beaker and cold water in a glass tube.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 118, 576, 137]]<|/det|>
Carry out the following instructions, referring to Fig. 2.1.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[141, 146, 850, 355]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[463, 368, 532, 387]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 2.1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 400, 720, 419]]<|/det|>
The glass tube must remain in the clamp throughout the experiment.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 431, 144, 450]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 431, 710, 450]]<|/det|>
Use one of the thermometers to measure the room temperature \(\theta_{\mathrm{R}}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[551, 462, 920, 481]]<|/det|>
<form>\(\theta_{\mathrm{R}} =\) ........................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 492, 146, 510]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 492, 529, 510]]<|/det|>
Pour \(50 \text{cm}^3\) of cold water into the glass tube.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 522, 504, 541]]<|/det|>
Pour \(300 \text{cm}^3\) of hot water into the beaker.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 555, 920, 588]]<|/det|>
In the first row of Table 2.1, for \(t = 0\), record the temperature \(\theta_{\mathrm{C}}\) of the water in the glass tube and the temperature \(\theta_{\mathrm{H}}\) of the water in the beaker.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 600, 737, 619]]<|/det|>
Place the glass tube in the beaker and immediately start the stopclock.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 632, 920, 666]]<|/det|>
Record, in Table 2.1, the temperatures \(\theta_{\mathrm{C}}\) of the water in the glass tube and the temperatures \(\theta_{\mathrm{H}}\) of the water in the beaker at times \(t = 30 \text{s}\), \(60 \text{s}\), \(90 \text{s}\), \(120 \text{s}\), \(150 \text{s}\) and \(180 \text{s}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 664, 920, 682]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 96, 91]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 742, 91]]<|/det|> In this experiment, you will investigate a circuit containing different resistors. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 103, 410, 121]]<|/det|> The circuit has been set up for you. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 118, 576, 137]]<|/det|> Carry out the following instructions, referring to Fig. 3.1. <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[210, 147, 784, 408]]<|/det|> <|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[465, 426, 532, 444]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 458, 144, 476]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 457, 245, 476]]<|/det|> Switch on. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 488, 650, 507]]<|/det|> Measure, and record in Table 3.1, the current \(I\) in the circuit. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 518, 855, 537]]<|/det|> Use the voltmeter to measure and record the potential difference \(V\) across resistor X. <|ref|>table_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[457, 549, 539, 567]]<|/det|> Table 3.1 <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[280, 580, 717, 707]]<|/det|>
resistor combination\(I/\)\(V/\)\(R/\)
X
X and Y

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 505, 890, 524]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 708, 920, 742]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 920, 107]]<|/det|>
A student wants to investigate the factors that affect the height to which a ball bounces when it is dropped.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 120, 920, 152]]<|/det|>
Plan an experiment that will enable him to investigate in detail how the height from which a ball is dropped affects how high it bounces.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 166, 522, 183]]<|/det|>
You are **not** required to carry out the experiment.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 197, 398, 214]]<|/det|>
The apparatus available includes:

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 228, 453, 244]]<|/det|>
balls of different materials and sizes

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 243, 437, 259]]<|/det|>
sheets of different floor coverings.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 274, 379, 291]]<|/det|>
Write a plan for the experiment.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 305, 324, 322]]<|/det|>
In your plan, you should:

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 336, 457, 353]]<|/det|>
· list any additional apparatus needed

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 368, 606, 384]]<|/det|>
· explain briefly how you would carry out the experiment

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 399, 920, 430]]<|/det|>
· describe a precaution which could be taken to ensure that measurements of the height of bounce are reliable

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 445, 530, 462]]<|/det|>
· state the key variables that you would control

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 476, 831, 508]]<|/det|>
· draw a table, with column headings, to show how you would display your readings (you are **not** required to enter any readings in the table)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 522, 712, 539]]<|/det|>
· explain how you could analyse your readings to reach a conclusion.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 553, 576, 570]]<|/det|>
You may draw a diagram if it helps to explain your plan.

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[435, 73, 561, 88]]<|/det|>
# BLANK PAGE
